result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason R. Weiland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason R. Weiland is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jason R. Weiland was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Iowa County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
**On 01/15/2020, JOC amended to indicate the restitution ordered is no longer joint/several with Mr. Nehls.  Mr. Weiland is soley responsible for the remaining restitution amount of $1,283.84**
Concurrent with: any other probation sentence(s).

miscConds.notes: No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription; absolute sobriety.
Submission of DNA sample to the Iowa County Sheriff's Department; random UAs/PBTs; any/all other counseling/programming deemed necessary/appropriate by DOC.

timeConds.notes:
Huber; may be served in Richland County
Consecutive to: Grant County case 16CF54

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief

Defendant Jason R. Weiland in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State recites joint recommendation: Ct 1 - dismissed.  Ct 2 - W/H  4 yrs probation, concurrent to any other probation term(s) - 6 mo jail w/ Huber, consecutive to Grant County case 16CF54, restitution $4583.84 joint/several w/ Derek Nehls,  AODA and follow up treatment, costs (no cps), no use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription, absolute sobriety, random UAs/PBTs, any other counseling or programming as recommended by DOC, DNA submission.  Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant.  No contest plea.  Defendant sworn by the Clerk.    Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation.  Court accepts the joint recommendation and sentences the defendant accordingly.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 5, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court, defendant Jason R. Weiland not in court, in custody.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request for adjourned PLEAS due to incarceration.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 11, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant Jason R. Weiland in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 11, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on February 14, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jason R. Weiland in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty McDougal feels she is missing some of the discovery.  Consolidation does not appear possible based on the RC DA.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 14, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on December 13, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jason R. Weiland in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing - colloquy given and knowing waiver accepted.  Information filed.  Review of charge/penalty.  Discussion of possible out of county consolidation.  Request for 60 days.  Status conference scheduled for December 13, 2016 at 11:00 am.
ADA Allen appears for State.  Jason Weiland appearing with his atty, Lisa McDougal.  Talking about consolidating with case from another county.  STC set for September 28, 2016
